result.execSummary:
The defendant Courtney E Littlehales was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Courtney E Littlehales is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Courtney E Littlehales was found guilty of Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Attorney to determine credit and submit form.

miscConds.notes: No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause. Do not use or possess illegally controlled substances. Possess no prescription medications without a valid prescription. Keep agent apporised of valid prescriptions.
Pay costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Courtney E Littlehales

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Also referenced ATN #41004545112081, arrest date 4-8-14, MPD2.

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 30 days at the House of Correction.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of  12 months.

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) do not use or possess illegally controlled substances; 4) possess no prescription medications without a valid prescription; 5) AODA, treatment or program; 6) seek & maintain employment; 7) keep agent apporised of valid prescriptions.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.

Attorney to determine credit and submit form.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to amended Count 1 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1as charged in the Amended Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

On motion of the State, Court orders Count 2 of the Original Information DISMISSED.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
